_source.contentraw:
Trump Family Allegedly Dislikes Don Jr.‚Äôs Elderly, Prune-Like Girl-Fiend

Andrew Anglin
December 6, 2022

Kimberly Guilfoyle used to date Gavin Newsom.

She is a kind of parasite that attaches to men‚Äôs necks.

It would be very strange if anyone liked her, save the man under her spell, who is the primary victim.

New York Post:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Rumors have been swirling that the Trump family ‚Äúdoesn‚Äôt like‚Äù Don Jr.‚Äôs fianc√©e Kimberly Guilfoyle ‚Äî but Eric Trump says he ‚Äúthinks the world‚Äù of her.

‚ÄúThe vibe is that the family doesn‚Äôt like Kim,‚Äù says a source. ‚ÄúShe is trying too hard to be in the family.‚Äù

But Eric told us when we reached out to him for comment, ‚ÄúI completely disagree with the narrative and happen to think the world of Kimberly.‚Äù

An insider tells us Don Jr. and Guilfoyle held a party at their $9.7 million Palm Beach, Fla., mansion this week for Toys for Tots that was DJ‚Äôd by Detroit rapper Kid Rock.

We‚Äôre told tongues were wagging over who was ‚Äî and wasn‚Äôt ‚Äî at the family at the bash, which was estimated to have 300 guests.

While Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner did not attend, a source tells us: ‚ÄúThey were invited to go, it was [Jewish sabbath] Shabbos. They have a good relationship. It‚Äôs just the rumor mill.‚Äù

Former President Donald Trump, we hear, came to the fundraiser for half-an-hour, but left before a ‚Äúholiday boat parade.‚Äù Eric Trump and his wife, Lara, were also in attendance.

Eric had only kind words for Guilfoyle, telling us, ‚ÄúI am best friends with Don and had an absolute blast at the party.‚Äù

Rumors that Guilfoyle might be on the outs with some of the Trump family started last month.

During Tiffany Trump‚Äôs wedding last month to billionaire Michael Boulos, Ivanka made headlines by cropping Guilfoyle out of a family photo shared on social media.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

This woman is 53 years old, and she is a low-down rough rider and a dirty dog. Old, used-up women who are on the dating market are always going to be bloodsuckers.

However, even if they weren‚Äôt, it makes zero sense why someone in a position of power and influence would choose such a person to have a romance with. Why would you not get a young girl?

I can‚Äôt ever think about this couple without thinking about when the groypers protested a Turning Point USA event they were at, and Guilfoyle went full ‚Äúangry mommy‚Äù mode and started telling our lads that their mothers are mad at them and they must not be able to have sex or they wouldn‚Äôt believe in things.

It was like a parody.

The two ended up disappearing out the back like Batman.

He later went on with the Jew Mark Levin and claimed that the Groypers are leftists.

The whole situation sort of demonstrated that being the son of a capable man doesn‚Äôt make you capable, and there may actually be a negative correlation.

Donald Trump would not bitch out when booed, and he definitely would not be riding dirty with a sneaky dog 53 years of age.

I won‚Äôt ever blame a man for a divorce, because men simply do not have rights in divorce courts and I genuinely do not believe that any man wants a divorce.

But I will say: Don Jr. has had a very serious fall from grace.

If your wife leaves you and you start dating a hot teenage girl, the wife is going to get very jealous and make overtures towards fixing things. If you start dating a rough-riding 53-year-old town bicycle, she‚Äôs going to say ‚Äúew, gross ‚Äì I really was too good for him.‚Äù

At the very least, we must say, a divorce man going full ‚Äúused-up hag‚Äù is not a strategy for getting the kids back.

https://dailystormer.in/trump-family-allegedly-dislikes-don-jr-s-elderly-prune-like-girl-fiend/

_source.content: @CompleteChristianity Exactly because of what Eric said (a common issue when looking at the Trinity Shield), I really don't prefer the Trinity Shield as a teaching image. It's logically/scripturally correct in its statements, but the image presents the idea that there are FOUR aspects of God, or even four persons, where the Father Son and Holy Spirit are persons who are begotten or proceed from "God", a sort of Super-Person who generates the other Three. *That* is of course not correct, but the image suggests it. The below image with the triangle showing all Three being connected as one God is better, but I prefer the image which shows only the Three, with the Son and Holy Spirit being begotten/proceeding from the Father. An easy clarification is then that the Son and Spirit are eternally coexistent with the Father, and have the fullness of the Father and are thus everything He is except for being the Father. I know Rome and the East have some disagreements here, but neither declare the other heretics over it... so for an image that right away doesn't create heretical implications for the viewer, I really prefer NOT using the Trinity Shield.

card.title: Same FBI Agent Behind Trump Surveillance Also Helped Censor Hunter Biden Laptop Story ‚Ä∫ American Greatness

_source.content: Same FBI Agent Behind Trump Surveillance Also Helped Censor Hunter Biden Laptop StoryAmerican Greatness ^ | December 5, 2022 | By Eric Lendrumhttps://amgreatness.com/2022/12/05/same-fbi-agent-behind-trump-surveillance-also-helped-censor-hunter-biden-laptop-story/According to the ‚ÄúTwitter Files‚Äù released by Elon Musk and journalist Matt Taibbi, the same FBI agent who played a crucial role in conducting illegal surveillance on Donald Trump‚Äôs 2016 campaign also played a part in censoring the Hunter Biden laptop story during the 2020 election.As reported by the Daily Caller, the files posted by Taibbi with Musk‚Äôs approval revealed many more key details about the process by which Twitter systematically censored conservative viewpoints, leading up to the banning of the New York Post‚Äôs story in October of 2020 just days before the election, even despite dissent from within and from Democratic lawmakers.FBI agent James Baker, who in 2020 was Twitter‚Äôs Deputy General Counsel, claimed after the Post story first came out that it was ‚Äúreasonable to assume‚Äù that the materials from Hunter‚Äôs laptop ‚Äúmay have been‚Äù hacked, and thus had to be banned under Twitter‚Äôs policy against sharing content that had been hacked or stolen.‚ÄúI support the conclusion that we need more facts to assess whether the materials were hacked. At this stage, however, it is reasonable for us to assume that they may have been and that caution is warranted,‚Äù Baker wrote in an email at the time, the text of which was posted by Taibbi. ‚ÄúThere are some facts that indicate that the materials may have been hacked, while there are others indicating that the computer was either abandoned and/or the owner consented to allow the repair shop to access it for at least some purposes.‚ÄùBut several years prior, while serving as general counsel for the FBI, Baker was the one who personally reviewed the FBI‚Äôs FISA (Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act) warrant against Trump campaign aide Carter Page. Although Baker‚Äôs superiors were initially reluctant to approve such a warrant due to the lack of evidence, the warrant was ultimately approved several months later after former British spy Christopher Steele submitted his now-debunked dossier claiming collusion between President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin.Baker has since defended the Steele dossier, even despite being completely discredited, claiming that ‚ÄúWhen a source shows up with a big stack of information, as in this case, you go to work. It came in from what appears to be a reliable source. He gives you all this information. Go to work. Try to validate it.‚ÄùBaker eventually fell under investigation himself by the Department of Justice after allegations arose that he had been sharing classified information with reporters. He resigned a disgrace in 2018, before being hired by Twitter in 2020.
_source.contentraw:
Same FBI Agent Behind Trump Surveillance Also Helped Censor Hunter Biden Laptop Story
American Greatness ^ | December 5, 2022 | By Eric Lendrum
https://amgreatness.com/2022/12/05/same-fbi-agent-behind-trump-surveillance-also-helped-censor-hunter-biden-laptop-story/

According to the ‚ÄúTwitter Files‚Äù released by Elon Musk and journalist Matt Taibbi, the same FBI agent who played a crucial role in conducting illegal surveillance on Donald Trump‚Äôs 2016 campaign also played a part in censoring the Hunter Biden laptop story during the 2020 election.

As reported by the Daily Caller, the files posted by Taibbi with Musk‚Äôs approval revealed many more key details about the process by which Twitter systematically censored conservative viewpoints, leading up to the banning of the New York Post‚Äôs story in October of 2020 just days before the election, even despite dissent from within and from Democratic lawmakers.

FBI agent James Baker, who in 2020 was Twitter‚Äôs Deputy General Counsel, claimed after the Post story first came out that it was ‚Äúreasonable to assume‚Äù that the materials from Hunter‚Äôs laptop ‚Äúmay have been‚Äù hacked, and thus had to be banned under Twitter‚Äôs policy against sharing content that had been hacked or stolen.

‚ÄúI support the conclusion that we need more facts to assess whether the materials were hacked. At this stage, however, it is reasonable for us to assume that they may have been and that caution is warranted,‚Äù Baker wrote in an email at the time, the text of which was posted by Taibbi. ‚ÄúThere are some facts that indicate that the materials may have been hacked, while there are others indicating that the computer was either abandoned and/or the owner consented to allow the repair shop to access it for at least some purposes.‚Äù

But several years prior, while serving as general counsel for the FBI, Baker was the one who personally reviewed the FBI‚Äôs FISA (Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act) warrant against Trump campaign aide Carter Page. Although Baker‚Äôs superiors were initially reluctant to approve such a warrant due to the lack of evidence, the warrant was ultimately approved several months later after former British spy Christopher Steele submitted his now-debunked dossier claiming collusion between President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin.

Baker has since defended the Steele dossier, even despite being completely discredited, claiming that ‚ÄúWhen a source shows up with a big stack of information, as in this case, you go to work. It came in from what appears to be a reliable source. He gives you all this information. Go to work. Try to validate it.‚Äù

Baker eventually fell under investigation himself by the Department of Justice after allegations arose that he had been sharing classified information with reporters. He resigned a disgrace in 2018, before being hired by Twitter in 2020.

FBI Plays Central Role In Twitter's Election Manipulation Operation

RonPaulLibertyReport

As the threads of "Twittergate" continue to unravel, one common theme continues to be the role of the FBI - both current and former members - in the scandal. From phony Russiagate to suppression of the Hunter Biden laptop just before the election, the FBI is front and center in the operation. Also today: Are weapons for Ukraine surfacing in west Africa?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Qs2zbaK7Ks

CFR deep state FBI chief Chris Wray warns violent ‚Äòdomestic terrorism‚Äô growing in US
By ERIC TUCKER and MARY CLARE JALONICK
March 2, 2021
‚ÄúJan. 6 was not an isolated event. The problem of domestic terrorism has been metas-tasizing across the country for a long time now and it‚Äôs not going away anytime soon,‚Äù Wray told lawmakers. ‚ÄúAt the FBI, we‚Äôve been sounding the alarm on it for a number of years now.‚Äù

Do CFR deep state intel agents have anything to do with infiltrating and helping organize domestic terrorist groups?

https://apnews.com/article/fbi-chris-wray-testify-capitol-riot-9a5539af34b15338bb5c4923907eeb67

April 29, 2019 FBI Director Wray, son of Council on Foreign Relations member Cecil Wray - briefs his Council on Foreign Relations handlers on Global Threats and National Security FBI Director Christopher Wray talked about the agency‚Äôs role in protecting the U.S. from international threats. These threats, Director Wray said, include China‚Äôs determination to advance economically at American expense. Following these remarks, he participated in a question and answer session. Topics included Special Counsel Robert Mueller‚Äôs report on Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election, and recruitment and retention at the FBI.
https://www.c-span.org/video/?460010-1/fbi-director-christopher-wray-speaks-council-foreign-relations

The federal government is lying and has been lying about key incidents, including cov-ering up its role and the facts in critical events such as the Oklahoma City Bombing, The New American Senior Editor William F. card.description: Make no mistake ‚Äì congressional subpoenas should not be optional.¬† But in today‚Äôs Department of Justice there are two standards.
card.title: Weaponized Justice Department's double standard ‚Äì one rule of law for Dems, another for GOP

_source.content: Here is another article that supports the one posted above.Excerpt:Though five years have passed since Hillary Clinton's State Department IT aide brazenly defied two congressional subpoenas to testify before the House Oversight Committee, which I chaired, Bryan Pagliano has still never been prosecuted.  But in an unprecedented show of alacrity, the Department of Justice (DOJ) last week somehow managed to indict former Trump adviser Steve Bannon for the same charge in record time.It turns out, congressional subpoenas can be enforced, but only if you play for the right team. Last week's hasty indictment marks a dramatic shift in Justice Department subpoena enforcement.  After allowing the Obama-Biden administration to run roughshod over congressional subpoena authority for years, everything has changed now that the Trump administration is in the crosshairs.  Make no mistake ‚Äì congressional subpoenas should not be optional.  But in today‚Äôs DOJ there are two standards. In the Fast and Furious case, former Attorney General Eric Holder was held in contempt of Congress. DOJ did nothing.  With the former State Department IT specialist, the DOJ refused to enforce our congressional referral for prosecution.I issued a subpoena for Pagliano's testimony in 2016.  He did not show up at the hearing.  I issued a second subpoena and had the U.S. Marshals serve him the paperwork so there was no ambiguity. Again, he refused to appear. Our committee voted on a straight party-line vote to hold him in contempt of Congress.Pagliano's failure to comply should have been an easy prosecution for DOJ. There was no executive privilege claim. He already had an immunity agreement in place, so he was facing no legal jeopardy. (Incidentally, Pagliano's sweetheart immunity deal with the DOJ inexplicably contained no provisions requiring him to cooperate with any investigation ‚Äì which is generally the whole point of an immunity agreement.)Even more bizarre was the way Pagliano and the State Department got away with thumbing his nose at the document requests. After working for years at the State Department in IT for the secretary of State specifically, we were expected to believe he had never sent or received a single email. The State Department claimed they could find nothing.Congress used to enforce its own subpoenas but turned over that role to the executive branch decades ago. Bad move.A subpoena is only effective if it can be enforced. I implored both Attorneys General Loretta Lynch and Jeff Sessions to prosecute Pagliano to ensure congressional subpoenas would have teeth. I pled with my Democratic colleagues on the House Oversight Committee to stand with me, understanding that one day they would be the ones seeking to enforce subpoenas.  None did.  Now they have suddenly found urgency and backbone for congressional oversight.Perhaps the only thing worse than a DOJ that refuses to enforce congressional subpoena authority is a DOJ that only enforces it when one party is in power. That is political weaponization of the legal system ‚Äì and it's happening right now.https://www.foxnews.com/opinion/weaponized-justice-departments-double-standard-jason-chaffetz
_source.contentraw:
Here is another article that supports the one posted above.

Excerpt:

Though five years have passed since Hillary Clinton's State Department IT aide brazenly defied two congressional subpoenas to testify before the House Oversight Committee, which I chaired, Bryan Pagliano has still never been prosecuted.

But in an unprecedented show of alacrity, the Department of Justice (DOJ) last week somehow managed to indict former Trump adviser Steve Bannon for the same charge in record time.

It turns out, congressional subpoenas can be enforced, but only if you play for the right team.

Last week's hasty indictment marks a dramatic shift in Justice Department subpoena enforcement. After allowing the Obama-Biden administration to run roughshod over congressional subpoena authority for years, everything has changed now that the Trump administration is in the crosshairs.

Make no mistake ‚Äì congressional subpoenas should not be optional. But in today‚Äôs DOJ there are two standards. In the Fast and Furious case, former Attorney General Eric Holder was held in contempt of Congress. DOJ did nothing. With the former State Department IT specialist, the DOJ refused to enforce our congressional referral for prosecution.

I issued a subpoena for Pagliano's testimony in 2016. He did not show up at the hearing. I issued a second subpoena and had the U.S. Marshals serve him the paperwork so there was no ambiguity. Again, he refused to appear. Our committee voted on a straight party-line vote to hold him in contempt of Congress.

Pagliano's failure to comply should have been an easy prosecution for DOJ. There was no executive privilege claim. He already had an immunity agreement in place, so he was facing no legal jeopardy. (Incidentally, Pagliano's sweetheart immunity deal with the DOJ inexplicably contained no provisions requiring him to cooperate with any investigation ‚Äì which is generally the whole point of an immunity agreement.)

Even more bizarre was the way Pagliano and the State Department got away with thumbing his nose at the document requests. After working for years at the State Department in IT for the secretary of State specifically, we were expected to believe he had never sent or received a single email. The State Department claimed they could find nothing.

Congress used to enforce its own subpoenas but turned over that role to the executive branch decades ago. Bad move.

A subpoena is only effective if it can be enforced. I implored both Attorneys General Loretta Lynch and Jeff Sessions to prosecute Pagliano to ensure congressional subpoenas would have teeth.

I pled with my Democratic colleagues on the House Oversight Committee to stand with me, understanding that one day they would be the ones seeking to enforce subpoenas. None did. Now they have suddenly found urgency and backbone for congressional oversight.

Perhaps the only thing worse than a DOJ that refuses to enforce congressional subpoena authority is a DOJ that only enforces it when one party is in power. That is political weaponization of the legal system ‚Äì and it's happening right now.

https://www.foxnews.com/opinion/weaponized-justice-departments-double-standard-jason-chaffetz

_source.content: MATTHEW 7:24-27 (ESV)‚ÄúEveryone then who hears these words of mine and does them will be like a wise man who built his house on the rock. And the rain fell, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house, but it did not fall, because it had been founded on the rock. And everyone who hears these words of mine and does not do them will be like a foolish man who built his house on the sand. And the rain fell, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat against that house, and it fell, and great was the fall of it.‚Äù1 CORINTHIANS 3:11 (ESV)For no one can lay a foundation other than that which is laid, which is Jesus Christ.https://www.biblegateway.com/A ‚Äúcult‚Äù is deemed so because it claims to have faith in Jesus (wrong ‚ÄúJesus‚Äù, but that‚Äôs another story), quote Scripture passages (WAY out of Biblical context) and fails to follow Him and Him ALONE. They do a good job of telling people about Jesus but fail to teach anyone about His finished work on the cross or His Resurrection. There‚Äôs ALWAYS someone else as a ‚Äúleader‚Äù. Examples: Charles ‚ÄúTaze‚Äù Russell of Jehovah‚Äôs Witnesses, Moses of the Hebrew Roots Movement (an offshoot of the false religion of Judaism), the pope/a priest/Mary of Roman Catholicism, Mary Baker Eddy of Christian Science, Joseph Smith of Latter Day Saints, L. Ron Hubbard of Scientology, Ellen G. White of Seventh Day Adventism, Eric vonAnderseck of Second Eighth Week Apostles and so on. Additionally, there are no contradictions in Scripture...EVER. It‚Äôs cults which add to Calvary, not The Lord.(SIDE NOTE - Salvation‚Äôs a GIFT, not a ‚ÄúWAGE‚Äù (Romans 6:23). The Lord is The CreatOR while we‚Äôre merely the creatED.)An incorrect version of ‚ÄúJesus‚Äù exists in ANY cult which includes those ‚Äúsalvation by works‚Äù people. It‚Äôs totally impossible to ‚Äúearn a gift‚Äù. No ‚ÄúJesus‚Äù in false religions. One doesn‚Äôt HAVE TO do things pertaining to Christianity, he or she GETS to. HUMONGOUS difference.) Christianity doesn‚Äôt teach anything like either ‚Äúsalvation by works‚Äù or ‚Äúreligion‚Äù (see Romans 6:23 for more information). Additionally, Scripture is BEYOND clear in 2 Corinthians 5:8 (absent with the body = present with The Lord). By contrast, salvation is ‚ÄúJust Jesus at Calvary and with His Resurrection. No artificial anything‚Äù. (‚ÄúThe Gospel ONLY‚Äù, in other words ‚Äì Keyword: ‚ÄúONLY‚Äù). Someone born again is only qualified to teach the new covenant (2 Corinthians 3:4-11). As such, that person is a partaker in the Divine Nature (2 Peter 1:3-4). We‚Äôre under grace. Jesus fulfilled 100% of the law. Because of that, He changes what you want should you decide to choose in His favor. (See Romans 5:10 and Hebrews 10:14 for more information.) People aren‚Äôt robots. Forever‚Äôs a long time.Will cheerfully do what The Lord says instead. Feel free to take matters up with The Author if there‚Äôs some ‚Äúproblem‚Äù with how He writes His Own Book. That 1-on-1 with The Lord happens with 100% of everyone whether he or she ‚Äúbelieves that way or not‚Äù (see Hebrews 9:27-28). Confidence on the Day of Judgment is critical. Psalm 118:8 implies that it‚Äôs better to trust in The Lord than it is to put confidence in man.

Examples: Charles ‚ÄúTaze‚Äù Russell of Jehovah‚Äôs Witnesses, Moses of the Hebrew Roots Movement (an offshoot of the false religion of Judaism), the pope/a priest/Mary of Roman Catholicism, Mary Baker Eddy of Christian Science, Joseph Smith of Latter Day Saints, L. Ron Hubbard of Scientology, Ellen G. White of Seventh Day Adventism, Eric vonAnderseck of Second Eighth Week Apostles and so on. Additionally, there are no contradictions in Scripture...EVER. It‚Äôs cults which add to Calvary, not The Lord.

(SIDE NOTE - Salvation‚Äôs a GIFT, not a ‚ÄúWAGE‚Äù (Romans 6:23). The Lord is The CreatOR while we‚Äôre merely the creatED.)

An incorrect version of ‚ÄúJesus‚Äù exists in ANY cult which includes those ‚Äúsalvation by works‚Äù people. It‚Äôs totally impossible to ‚Äúearn a gift‚Äù. No ‚ÄúJesus‚Äù in false religions. One doesn‚Äôt HAVE TO do things pertaining to Christianity, he or she GETS to. HUMONGOUS difference.) Christianity doesn‚Äôt teach anything like either ‚Äúsalvation by works‚Äù or ‚Äúreligion‚Äù (see Romans 6:23 for more information). Additionally, Scripture is BEYOND clear in 2 Corinthians 5:8 (absent with the body = present with The Lord).

By contrast, salvation is ‚ÄúJust Jesus at Calvary and with His Resurrection. No artificial anything‚Äù. (‚ÄúThe Gospel ONLY‚Äù, in other words ‚Äì Keyword: ‚ÄúONLY‚Äù). Someone born again is only qualified to teach the new covenant (2 Corinthians 3:4-11). As such, that person is a partaker in the Divine Nature (2 Peter 1:3-4). We‚Äôre under grace. Jesus fulfilled 100% of the law. Because of that, He changes what you want should you decide to choose in His favor. (See Romans 5:10 and Hebrews 10:14 for more information.) People aren‚Äôt robots. Forever‚Äôs a long time.

Will cheerfully do what The Lord says instead. Feel free to take matters up with The Author if there‚Äôs some ‚Äúproblem‚Äù with how He writes His Own Book. That 1-on-1 with The Lord happens with 100% of everyone whether he or she ‚Äúbelieves that way or not‚Äù (see Hebrews 9:27-28). Confidence on the Day of Judgment is critical. Psalm 118:8 implies that it‚Äôs better to trust in The Lord than it is to put confidence in man.
